title: Jean-Baptiste Christyn the Younger
text:
Jean-Baptiste Christyn (c.1635–1707), knight, was a lawyer and author in the <a href="Spanish%20Netherlands">Spanish Netherlands</a>.
Life.
Christyn was born in Brussels around 1635. As a <a href="Licentiate%20of%20Laws">Licentiate of Laws</a> he practised law in the city of Brussels for a number of years, until in 1697 appointed a judge of the <a href="Council%20of%20Brabant">Council of Brabant</a> alongside his uncle <a href="Libert-Fran%C3%A7ois%20Christyn">Libert-François Christyn</a>. He died in Brussels in 1707.
He wrote a number of works on legal matters. "Les délices des Pays-Bas: ou Description géographique et historique des XVII. provinces belgiques", a historical <a href="chorography">chorography</a> of the <a href="Low%20Countries">Low Countries</a> first published in 1697, has been attributed to him, but also to another of his uncles, <a href="Chancellor%20of%20Brabant">Chancellor</a> <a href="Jean-Baptiste%20Christyn">Jean-Baptiste Christyn</a>.
